text: Farm at Konanur Papaya farm at Konanur Konanur or Paduvalamarahalli is a village in Nanjangud taluk of Mysore district, Karnataka state, India. ==Location== Konanur is located about 15 km from the nearest town of Chamarajanagar.https://villageinfo.in/karnataka/mysore/nanjangud/paduvalamarahalli.html Nanjangud town is also nearby.https://www.google.com/maps/place/Konanur+Railway+Station/@12.0144287,76.8317596,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x3baf38a38a174e0b:0x4bf1a1de7f5bb19b!8m2!3d12.0144287!4d76.8339537 ==Demographics== There are 1,924 people in the village living in 482 houses. The total area of the village is 705 hectares.https://villageinfo.in/karnataka/mysore/nanjangud/paduvalamarahalli.html ==Landmarks== The village has a panchayath office, one government school and two private schools. There are many temples around the lake in the village. ==Transportation== The village has a railways station called Konanur railway station. It comes in the Mysore-Chamarajnagar branchline. There are three trains every day to Mysore and Chamarajanagar on either sides. ==See also== *Nanjangud Town *Chinnada Gudi Hundi *Narasam Budhi *Kavalande *Badana Guppe *Mariyala-Gangavadi Halt *Chamarajanagar *Mukkadahalli ==Image gallery== File:Konanur Temple2.jpg|Konanur Devasthana File:Konanur Kere.jpg|Konanur Kere File:Konanur Panchayath Office.jpg|Panchayath Office File:Konanur Railway Station.jpg|Railway Station File:Lakeside temple at Konanur.jpg|Lakeside temple ==References== Category:Villages in Mysore district
title: Konanur, Mysore
